summary: This code provides instructions for modifying browsers and security settings to allow running a specific code, possibly related to web sockets. It mentions alternative tools like PhantomJS or Electron, and suggests checking if the code can be run without patches.

details.comment: This code provides instructions for modifying browsers and security settings to allow running a specific code, possibly related to web sockets. It mentions alternative tools like PhantomJS or Electron, and suggests checking if the code can be run without patches.
details.content:
go ahead, solve your problem in a brand new way instead of just manual looking and pasting. that's the purpose.
diff rule: similar -> perform similarity test -> continue on children
they force me to become a hacker. they deserve this: death.
background -> request, handle cookies, browser history, favourites.
tabs -> content processing, subrequest.
firefox -> about:config -> websocket allow from https
or add your root certificate. or just allow exceptions:
certificate manager -> server -> add exception
chrome -> chrome://flags -> allow invalid certs from localhost
allow insecure websockets.
add ca to system so normal code will be running fine.
term->html:
gem install terminal
https://github.com/buildkite/terminal-to-html
disable safety protocols. -> cors allowed -> plugin
<RECOMPILE>
what is the browser worker?
so there are two choices: phantomjs, electron.
or many alternatives.
check if possible to run nightmare without patch?
